lines.text: ...there have been several incidents with nurses.
Oh, come, come, Stoppidge, you know as well as I that all young Doctors indulge in a bit of jiggery pokery.
Sir, I do not object to jiggery but I take exception to pokery!
Ahh this is the new kidney case.
Yes Mr Bean.
Ahh, Kidney Bean.
Excuse me, sir!
Miss Fosdick, don't keep plucking at me I'm not a chicken.
I'm sorry sir but you have an appointment at the Berkley Nursing home at eleven.
It can wait.
It's to see Mrs Moore sir.
and she... Oh that's different, rather wealthy private patient of mine, I took her appendix out the other day.
Well I hope you both had a nice time.
I'll make the jokes thank you, Stoppidge.
I feel wonderful Mr Carver, I had no idea having one's appendix out could be so exhilarating. I feel ten years younger.
Splendid! Splendid!
Be honest now. Do I really look like a woman of forty?
You really feel as young as that?
No, that's what I am!
...they told me you were a wonderful surgeon.
Well I suppose I am a cut above the rest.

[waiter serves the wine for Ellen and Mr. Carver]
This is the happiest moment of my life!
I would taste it first, mate, if I was you.
She thinks every man is after her.

[to the nurse]
Well, we can't have her disturbing the rest of the patients like this.

[to Miss. Armitage]
Now come, come, Miss Armitage. We mustn't be a silly girl, must we?

[shouting]
Keep back! Keep back!
You know me. I'm Doctor Stoppidge.
Hmph. You're all the same. You're only after one thing.
No, no - that'd be quite untrue, Miss. Armitage. I only want to get you into bed.

[screaming]
Get out of here, you sex maniacs!
All right, Dr. Cookie.
Nookey, mate, Nookey.
Yes, yes - Cookie.

[introducing Nookey]
This is Doctor Kinky.
Cookie. No, no, no... I mean Nookey.
Hmm. That's a good skeleton. Did the last doctor leave it here?
That is the last doctor.
I'll call you "Sunday".
Well, I won't be in.
I'm sorry doctor but I cannot stay with that man any longer.
Why, what happened?
I'd rather not say. All they think about is whisky and sex.
Well where he comes from they can't get soda.
You don't have to move out, you know. It's a big bed.
Well as I told you earlier today, I'm not your sort of woman.
I don't mean anything nasty. I'll marry you first.
Marry me? Are you mad? Marry me in the middle of the night?
Where I come from it's a very simple ceremony.
[He produced a knife. Matron screams]
It's all right, nothing to worry about. We just make a quick cut in each other's left hand, put them together, say "We are one" and it's all legal.
Oh... I see... sort of instant wedlock?
That's it. Only out there they call it a bleedin' ceremony.
Yes, they often call it that here too.
Right, are you ready then?
No! I have no urge to marry you.
Oh, don't worry about that. The urge comes later!
